data.title: Barbra Streisand's husband James Brolin labeled as 'whipping boy' causing concern
data.meta_description: Barbra Streisand faces low book sales and marital strain with James Brolin, as revealed by insiders.
data.text:
Reports have surfaced indicating that Barbra Streisand's recent memoir, My Name is Barbra, has experienced disappointing sales, contributing to tensions in her marriage to actor James Brolin, according to RadarOnline.com.

The book sold only 210,000 copies in its initial weeks, a figure that has reportedly left the acclaimed singer and actress frustrated.

Further complicating matters, Streisand has faced criticism for allegedly overlooking the contributions of the late fashion designer Nolan Miller in her memoir, instead attributing her 1994 comeback tour wardrobe to Donna Karan.

A close associate of Miller, known for his work on the television series Dynasty, has contested Streisand's account, claiming Miller was the true designer behind her iconic dresses.

Additionally, the couple has been embroiled in controversy following revelations that Streisand's film company received a $200,000 grant from the government's COVID-19 Paycheck Protection Program, intended to support staff salaries at her oceanfront estate.

READ MORE: Golden Bachelor’s Leslie Fhima cuddles up with 50 Cent - and fans slam Gerry

This move has reportedly surprised and disappointed fans, given Streisand's substantial net worth estimated at $400 million.

Sources close to the couple have expressed concern over the impact of these stresses on their relationship, with Brolin, 83, feeling the strain.

"Jim is sick of being her whipping boy," an insider told the National Enquirer.

"She's in his face constantly and complaining about this or that." The source added, "He has the patience of a saint, but friends wonder why he puts up with it. Barbra's so needy and demanding and treats him like a doormat."

DON'T MISS...

Taylor Swift-Biden conspiracy believed by staggering amount and mostly Trumpers

Taylor Swift safely flees Kansas City and preps first show since tragic shooting

Kanye West’s furious rant blasts Swifties 'declaring war' against his new album

The situation has reportedly escalated to the point where Brolin is contemplating a break, as the insider noted, "Lately — even by his standards — she's been off the charts. A vacation from marriage is sounding really good about now!"

Inquiries for comment from Streisand and Brolin's representatives have been made by RadarOnline.com, but no responses have been received as of yet.
